results.title: Compulsion
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Richard Zanuck, Cinema Scope Pictures and Darryl F. Zanuck
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of the Leopold-Loeb murder case, Orson Welles stars as lawyer Jonathan Wilk, whose defence against capital punishment saves the lives of two teenagers , Judd and Artie. The two homosexual teenagers were charged with murdering a young boy as an example of their intellectual superiority. Bradford Dillman and Dean Stockwell star as the two accused, one sadistic, the other submissive, in this dramatic character study based on newspaper reporter Meyer Levin’s bestseller.

results.title: Torment = Hets
results.brief_description: The storyline of this film, although simple and straightforward, reveals a beautifully observed and incise psychological drama, written by Ingmar Bergman when he was 26 years old. It is the tale of sadistic teacher in a cheerless and strict school who takes delight in exercising his reign of terror over his Latin classes. One evening as final examination time approaches, one of his students, Jan-Erik, goes to the aid of Bertha, the newsagents assistant who is drunk in the street. They become lovers, but Jan-Erik is aware of the presence of another man in her life who frightens her. He finds Bertha dead in her room and on finding the teacher in her hallway discovers he is the other man. The teacher is arrested, but is released when the cause of her death is revealed as heart failure coupled with malnutrition. Following a confrontation with the teacher in the headmasters study, Jan-Erik is expelled from school, but when the headmaster becomes aware of the teachers tyrannical methods, the boy is reinstated and the teacher punished for his crimes.

results.title: The Shop on High Street = Obchod na korze
results.creator_credit: Emar Klos, Jan Kadar, Ceskoslovensky Filmexport and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: The film is set during World War II in the ‘independent’ facist Slovak statelet. It concerns Tono Brtko (Jozef Kroner), a carpenter who is appointed “Aryan controller” of a button shop by his facist brother-in-law. The shop is owned by the Jewish Frau Lautmann (Ida Kaminska, doyenne of the Yiddish Theatre in Poland), who is not only elderly but deaf and short-sighted, and thinks that Tono is her new assistant. Through a mixture of weakness, vacillation and decency he fails to disabuse her, and a mutually beneficial relationship develops. Meanwhile, the fascist authorities have other plans for the town’s Jews. This is an extraordinarily effective picture of ‘everyday fascism’ in a small community, and although it revolves around a grim and tragic theme, it is played largely as a gentle comedy. Winner of the 1965 Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Adapted from a novel by Ladislav Grosman. In Czech with English sub-titles.

results.title: Eyes without a face
results.brief_description: Pierre Brasseur plays a surgeon who adopts extreme measures in his attempts to restore his daughter’s face (Edith Scob), horribly disfigured in a car crash. His obsessive efforts require him and his loyal assistant (Alida Valli) to kidnap young women and graft their features onto his daughter. Director Georges Franju and cinematographer Eugen Shuftan transform the pulp horror material into an eerie and surreal Cocteau-like nightmare. Eyes Without a Face has been remade twice by Spanish director Jess Franco, first as ‘The Awful Dr. Orloff’ and later as Faceless. Described by Franju as ‘an anguish film’, this film contains some haunting images, none more striking than Scob’s tortured eyes staring out from her stark, white expressionless mask. Music by Maurice Jarre. Based on a novel by Jean Redon. Also known as ‘The Horror chamber of Dr. Faustus’. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: A Generation = Pokolenie
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda, Ignacy Taub and Zespol Filmowy KADR
results.brief_description:
The first of Wajda’s unplanned war trilogy (with “Kanal” and “Ashes and Diamonds”) offers a strikingly unsentimental appraisal of heroism in this tale of a cocky Polish youth who decides to fight the Nazis after he falls for a pretty Resistance leader. Barely out of their teens, he and his brash friends approach their first mission - to help escapees during the Warsaw gheto uprising - like a game of cops and robbers. Inevitably the game turns deadly and the innocence of a generation is lost under the gruelling conditions of war. Adapted by Bohdan Czeszko from his novel. In Polish with English sub-titles.
Cast includes Roman Polanski

results.title: They loved life = Canal = Kanal
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda and Zespol Filmowy KADR
results.brief_description: The second of Wajda’s unplanned war trilogy (with “A generation” and “Ashes and diamond”. A grim depiction of a defeated Poland is the central theme of this moving story of the tragic heroism of a platoon of the underground national army who were loyal to the government in exile of Poland based in London. Based on actual events, this powerful movie shows the Resistance fighters’ descent into the sewers of Warsaw to escape the Nazis during the uprising in 1944; also shown as a psychological descent into the minds of a crushed people; and a times a slow descent into hell, reminiscent of Dante. The extreme situation of their journey through the ‘kanal’ brings out the true values of their characters: their generosity, pettiness, love, courage - and the price they must pay for their faith. This film is a skilful blending of suspense with social realism and poetical vision and, following its release, became instrumental in focusing world attention on the Warsaw uprising, the Polish experience and the arrival of a new national cinema. In Polish with English sub-titles. Winner of the Silver Palm in Cannes (1957) and Gold Medal at the Moscow Film Festival (1957)

results.title: The Big easy
results.creator_credit: Jim McBride, Stephen J. Friedman and Kings Road Entertainment
results.brief_description: The Big Easy is a sexy thriller romance set in New Orleans. When a member of the mafia is murdered in downtown New Orleans, Remy McSwain (Dennis Quaid) and Anne Osborne (Ellen Barkin) are unwittingly forced together as they pursue the murderer who may or may not be a cop. Barkin’s starchy D.A. prosecutor disapproves of the shady ethical practises of McSwain and his ‘Big Easy’ co-workers, who view bribery as a normal way of life. Remy McSwain, who comes from a large family of New Orleans policemen starts to reevaluate his values and life as he and Osborne become closer. Jim McBride has created a rivetting and fun film which revels in it’s complex characters and in the sizzling chemistry between Dennis Quaid and Ellen Barkin. Ned Beatty and Charles Ludlam are good in supporting roles and the film pulses with great cajun music and a sense of life in New Orleans.

results.title: Jude
results.creator_credit: Michael Winterbottom, Andrew Eaton and Revolution Films
results.brief_description: Jude Fawley is a stonemason who loves learning. Inspired by his childhood schoolmaster, he longs to attend university and singlemindedly studies in the hope of gaining a place. His studies are interrupted when Jude blindly falls for and marries Arabella Dunn, the daughter of a local pig farmer. After a brief and unhappy marriage he moves to Christminster to be closer to his beloved scholars. There he meets and falls fatally in love with his cousin Sue Bridehead. The ill-fated lovers join in an illicit union that flouts society’s conventions and tragedy ensues. Based on the novel “Jude the obscure” by Thomas Hardy.

results.title: A Night in Casablanca
results.creator_credit: Archie Mayo, David Leow and Louis Vista Productions
results.brief_description: The setting for this inspired piece of Marx mayhem is the fabulous Hotel Casablanca in North Africa, where the hotel managers are dropping like flies. Each one is being murdered as he innocently blunders onto the stolen jewels and art treasures hidden in the hotel by a gang of escaped Nazis. Enter Groucho as the new manager, with Chico as his self-appointed bodyguard, aided and abetted by Harpo, the mischevious valetto villainous gang leader, Sig Rumann, and pandemonium quickly ensues. In their last important film together, the Marx Brothers are pulled into one crazy situation after another. The many plot twists put the boys through their hilarious paces, building the action to a sustained frenzy, and culminating in an outrageous chase scene complete with airplane acrobatics.
